data.title: Pistol Permits
data.meta_description: Learn about concealed carry permits and download forms: To review West Virginia’s code on obtaining a license to carry deadly weapons, please visit West Virginia Legislature’s site, and…
data.text:
Learn about concealed carry permits and download forms:

To review West Virginia’s code on obtaining a license to carry deadly weapons, please visit West Virginia Legislature’s site, and House Bill 4145.

Applicants must apply in the county in which they reside. Applications are available for download below, or can be picked up at the courthouse in Charleston. Completed applications can only be returned to the Charleston office and cannot be accepted at the detachments.

After you have completed the application, you may mail or return the form to the Kanawha County Sheriff’s Tax Division along with the $50 non-refundable application fee, firearms certification form (certifications from online courses are not accepted), a copy of the instructor’s NRA certification, and a copy of the applicant’s driver’s license or its equivalent with photo and correct physical address. Please see above link for more information on these requirements.

The mailing address is:

Kanawha County Sheriff’s Office

Pistol Permit Processing

409 Virginia St E, Room 120

Charleston, West Virginia, 25301

Once the application is received, it will be processed within 45 days. You will be notified by US Mail once processing is complete. If the application is approved, you will receive a letter letting you know that the license will be available for pickup at the Kanawha County Sheriff’s Office – Tax Division.

*Please ensure that your printer can print duplex (i.e. front and back) as only applications printed on one sheet of paper can be accepted per WV State Police.

Forms:

Concealed Weapons Permit Application and Packet – For ages 21 and over

Provisional Concealed Weapons Permit Application – For ages 18-21 ONLY

Concealed Weapons Fee Structure

Concealed Weapons – Change of Address Form
